card0.name: Pikachu
card0.description: Pikachu that can generate powerful electricity have cheek sacs that are extra soft and super stretchy.

card1.name: Charizard
card1.description: It spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. It may cause forest fires by blowing flames.

card2.name: Bulbasaur
card2.description: A strange seed was planted on its back at birth. The plant sprouts and grows with this POKéMON.

card3.name: Squirtle
card3.description: After birth, its back swells and hardens into a shell. Powerfully sprays foam from its mouth.

card4.name: Caterpie
card4.description: Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.

card5.name: Weedle
card5.description: Often found in forests, eating leaves. It has a sharp venomous stinger on its head.

card6.name: Pidgey
card6.description: A common sight in forests and woods. It flaps its wings at ground level to kick up blinding sand.

card7.name: Rattata
card7.description: Bites anything when it attacks. Small and very quick, it is a common sight in many places.

card8.name: Spearow
card8.description: Eats bugs in grassy areas. It has to flap its short wings at high speed to stay airborne.

card9.name: Ekans
card9.description: Moves silently and stealthily. Eats the eggs of birds, such as PIDGEY and SPEAROW, whole.

card10.name: Cleffa
card10.description: According to local rumors, Cleffa are often seen in places where shooting stars have fallen.

card11.name: Golbat
card11.description: It loves to drink other creatures’ blood. It’s said that if it finds others of its kind going hungry, it sometimes shares the blood it’s gathered.

card12.name: Umbreon
card12.description: When exposed to the moon’s aura, the rings on its body glow faintly and it gains a mysterious power.

card13.name: Varoom
card13.description: It is said that this Pokémon was born when an unknown poison Pokémon entered and inspirited an engine left at a scrap-processing factory.

card14.name: Chien-Pao
card14.description: This Pokémon can control 100 tons of fallen snow. It plays around innocently by leaping in and out of avalanches it has caused.

card15.name: Koraidon
card15.description: This seems to be the Winged King mentioned in an old expedition journal. It was said to have split the land with its bare fists.

card16.name: Sandslash
card16.description: The drier the area Sandslash lives in, the harder and smoother the Pokémon’s spikes will feel when touched.

card17.name: Rhyhorn
card17.description: Strong, but not too bright, this Pokémon can shatter even a skyscraper with its charging tackles.

card18.name: Gengar
card18.description: To steal the life of its target, it slips into the prey’s shadow and silently waits for an opportunity.

card19.name: Wooper
card19.description: This Pokémon lives in cold water. It will leave the water to search for food when it gets cold outside.

card20.name: Pawmot
card20.description: This Pokémon normally is slow to react, but once it enters battle, it will strike down its enemies with lightning-fast movements.

card21.name: Ampharos
card21.description: The bright light on its tail can be seen far away. It has been treasured since ancient times as a beacon.

card22.name: Fuecoco
card22.description: It lies on warm rocks and uses the heat absorbed by its square-shaped scales to create fire energy.

card23.name: Tepig
card23.description: It can deftly dodge its foe’s attacks while shooting fireballs from its nose. It roasts berries before it eats them.

card24.name: Smoliv
card24.description: It protects itself from enemies by emitting oil from the fruit on its head. This oil is bitter and astringent enough to make someone flinch.

card25.name: Tinkatink
card25.description: It swings its handmade hammer around to protect itself, but the hammer is often stolen by Pokémon that eat metal.

card26.name: Meowth
card26.description: All it does is sleep during the daytime. At night, it patrols its territory with its eyes aglow.

card27.name: Steelix
card27.description: It is said that if an Onix lives for over 100 years, its composition changes to become diamond-like.

card28.name: Guzzlord
card28.description: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

card29.name: Eiscue
card29.description: On hot days, these Pokémon press their ice cube heads together and pass the time cooling each other down.

card30.name: Togekiss
card30.description: These Pokémon are never seen anywhere near conflict or turmoil. In recent times, they’ve hardly been seen at all.

card31.name: Gligar
card31.description: Gligar glides through the air without a sound as if it were sliding. This Pokémon hangs on to the face of its foe using its clawed hind legs and the large pincers on its forelegs, then injects the prey with its poison barb.

card32.name: Lycanroc
card32.description: Lycanroc attacks its prey with its sharp claws and fangs. It loyally obeys the instructions of a Trainer it trusts.

card33.name: Scraggy
card33.description: If it locks eyes with you, watch out! Nothing and no one is safe from the reckless headbutts of this troublesome Pokémon.

card34.name: Nidorina
card34.description: The horn on its head has atrophied. It’s thought that this happens so Nidorina’s children won’t get poked while their mother is feeding them.

card35.name: Mimokyu
card35.description: This Pokémon lives in dark places untouched by sunlight. When it appears before humans, it hides itself under a cloth that resembles a Pikachu.
